alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued March 10 at 3:22AM MST until March 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds paired with a fresh snowpack may create periods of ground blizzard conditions that may reduce visibility to near 0 miles.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
